p: The relatively strong influence of sea-surface temperature on body size is supported by the similarity of results on adult body sizes and life history characteristics for the amphitropical hippid crab, E. analoga across hemispheres. The stronger latitudinal response in body size found along the California coast also provides an example of the role of environmental steepness, such as thermal gradients, in shaping broad scale macroecological patterns (e.g. [ 71]).
